dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.trigger

Class AbstractTrigger

  • java.lang.Object
    • dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.trigger.AbstractTrigger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<AbstractTrigger>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractConfigurableTrigger

    public abstract class AbstractTrigger
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<AbstractTrigger>
    The base implementation of a trigger.

    A trigger is the equivalent to an eclipse action for Guided Configuration Wizard. A trigger is used to dock starting action somewhere in the GUI or commandline.

    Triggers are registered via the TriggerRegistry. The TriggerRegistry queries the extension-point dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.plugin.trigger to query triggers but also allows to register new triggers via Java code.

    Different implementations of the AbstractTrigger class represent different GUI docking points. E.g. SidebarTrigger to register to the sidebar view or AutoConfigureTrigger to register to the auto configure dialog.

    If a trigger shows up in the GUI is guarded by a visibility evaluation provided by the method isVisible(). In case of triggers registered via extension-point the extension-point provides a visibility expression that uses the context API (AbstractContext) to determine if a trigger is visible.

    A trigger provides a run(Map) method that, dependent on the type of the trigger, either shows up the wizard or directly runs the wizard result operation AbstractBackend.doRun().

    Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

    Since:
    2008.b

        Constructor for wizards with an explicit wizard type.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the trigger
        wizardId - The id of the wizard
        label - The label in the GUI of the trigger (e.g. on the button)
        icon - The optional icon shown in the GUI of the trigger (e.g. on a button)
        description - The optional tooltip

      • AbstractTrigger

        protected AbstractTrigger(java.lang.String id,
                          java.lang.String wizardId,
                          java.lang.String label,
                          org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image icon,
                          java.lang.String description,
                          java.lang.String type)
        Constructor for autoconfigure wizards. Here the trigger can have a configuration id which differs from the wizardId because there can exist several instances for one registered trigger. By default the configId is set to the triggerId.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the trigger
        wizardId - The id of the wizard
        label - The label in the GUI of the trigger (e.g. on the button)
        icon - The optional icon shown in the GUI of the trigger (e.g. on a button)
        description - The optional tooltip
        type - The type of the trigger
        Since:
        10

        wizardId - The id of the wizard
        wizardType - WIZARD_TYPE_DIALOG|WIZARD_TYPE_EDITOR
        label - The label in the GUI of the trigger (e.g. on the button)
        icon - The optional icon shown in the GUI of the trigger (e.g. on a button)
        description - The optional tooltip
        Since:

      • AbstractTrigger

        protected AbstractTrigger(java.lang.String id,
                          java.lang.String wizardId,
                          java.lang.String wizardType,
                          boolean undoRedo,
                          java.lang.String label,
                          org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image icon,
                          java.lang.String description,
                          java.lang.String type)
        Constructor for wizards in the Sidebar with an explicit wizard type. The configId is by default set to the wizardId.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the trigger
        wizardId - The id of the wizard
        wizardType - WIZARD_TYPE_DIALOG|WIZARD_TYPE_EDITOR
        undoRedo - If the trigger shall provide Undo/Redo functionality (only relevant for Dialogs!)
        label - The label in the GUI of the trigger (e.g. on the button)
        icon - The optional icon shown in the GUI of the trigger (e.g. on a button)
        description - The optional tooltip
        type - The type of the trigger
        Since:
        10

      • AbstractTrigger

        protected AbstractTrigger(java.lang.String id,
                          java.lang.String wizardId,
                          java.lang.String wizardType,
                          boolean undoRedo,
                          java.lang.String label,
                          org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image icon,
                          java.lang.String description,
                          java.lang.String type,
                          int width,
                          int height)
        Constructor for wizards in the Sidebar with an explicit wizard type. The configId is by default set to the wizardId.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the trigger
        wizardId - The id of the wizard
        wizardType - WIZARD_TYPE_DIALOG|WIZARD_TYPE_EDITOR
        undoRedo - If the trigger shall provide Undo/Redo functionality (only relevant for Dialogs!)
        label - The label in the GUI of the trigger (e.g. on the button)
        icon - The optional icon shown in the GUI of the trigger (e.g. on a button)
        description - The optional tooltip
        type - The type of the trigger
        width - The initial width (only used for wizardType WIZARD_TYPE_DIALOG)
        height - The initial height (only used for wizardType WIZARD_TYPE_DIALOG)
        Since:
        18.0

      • isVisible

        public boolean isVisible()
        Checks if there is a valid selection. The default implementation checks that at least one project selected which has to be loaded.
        Returns:
        true if the trigger will be visible, false if not
        Since:
        2008.b

      • run

        public void run(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,IContext> context)
        Run the current trigger with the given context. In case of a sidebar trigger this opens up the dialog. In case of an autoconfigure trigger runs the wizards without user interaction.
        Parameters:
        context - The current contexts
        Since:
        2008.b
